# NSMenuToolbarItem

**Class**

A control that presents a menu in a window’s toolbar.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class NSMenuToolbarItem
```

## Overview

If you set an action on an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuToolbarItem] control item, the user invokes the action when clicking on the item through pressing and holding to display the menu. If you set an action on the item and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuToolbarItem/showsIndicator] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the system displays the indicator as a separate segment so the user can invoke the menu with a click on that segment.

If you don’t set an action on the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuToolbarItem], a simple click invokes the menu, and the indicator is purely decorative.

## Configuring a menu toolbar item

- **showsIndicator**: A Boolean value that determines whether the toolbar item displays an indicator of additional functionality.
- **menu**: The menu presented from the toolbar item.
- **itemMenu**

## Items

- **NSToolbarItem**: A single item that appears in a window’s toolbar.
- **NSToolbarItemGroup**: A group of subitems in a toolbar item.
- **NSToolbarItemGroup.ControlRepresentation**
- **NSToolbarItemGroup.SelectionMode**: A value that indicates how a grouped toolbar item selects its subitems.
- **NSSearchToolbarItem**: A toolbar item that contains a search field optimized for performing text-based searches.
- **NSTrackingSeparatorToolbarItem**: A toolbar separator that aligns with the vertical split view in the same window.
